benchmark_details.name: GEOHALUBENCH (Geospatial Hallucination Benchmark)
benchmark_details.overview: GEOHALUBENCH is a comprehensive evaluation framework aimed at systematically assessing and mitigating geospatial hallucinations in large language models (LLMs) through structured questions derived from geospatial knowledge graphs.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To systematically evaluate and mitigate geospatial hallucinations in large language models.

data.source: Constructed from OpenStreetMap and Foursquare's Open Source Places.
data.annotation: Automatically generated based on factual knowledge and hallucination patterns.

methodology.calculation: Evaluation metrics based on macro-averaged accuracy across geospatial tasks.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy indicates better performance in correctly identifying factual information versus hallucinations.
methodology.validation: Evaluated across 20 advanced LLMs with detailed error analysis.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: All data is sourced from publicly available databases under respective licenses.
